title: Publisher Rocket Is Great For Amazon Ads… But You’re Doing It Wrong

tactics.name: Cross-Reference Keywords
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket keywords across title, subtitle, and ads to maximize visibility
steps: Input keywords into Publisher Rocket's keyword tool
Generate keyword lists for categories, titles, and ads
Cross-reference keywords between title/subtitle and ad campaigns
caveats: Avoid using author names/famous books in titles
source_quotes: you don't have to think just because it's good for the Amazon ads keyword area... that means it's only for the ads

tactics.name: Keyword Optimization
tactics.description: Use keywords in titles, subtitles, descriptions, and author bios to improve discoverability.
steps: Scatter keywords in description and author bio
Create a keyword cloud for multiple books
caveats: Avoid direct copying of titles/cover designs
Do not use author names in titles
source_quotes: these keywords are going to be your title your subtitle the seven keywords that you have for your book

tactics.name: Keyword Ratio Optimization
tactics.description: Use Publisher Rocket for high-volume keywords and Katie Spy to maintain a keyword ratio under 100
steps: Use Publisher Rocket to identify high search volume keywords
Cross-check with Katie Spy to ensure ratio stays under 100
caveats: When tools conflict, prioritize the ratio generated by Katie Spy
source_quotes: keep it under 100 that's your core keyword

tactics.name: Keyword Cloud Strategy
tactics.description: Scatter low search volume keywords across books to improve discoverability
steps: Distribute keywords across book titles and descriptions
caveats: Avoid over-optimization that may dilute focus
source_quotes: we're just peppering all of our different books

heuristics.name: Review-Driven Keyword Boost
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize keywords with higher review counts
source_quotes: we need to get people there if you think that if you publish it they will come they are definitely not coming

heuristics.name: Low-Volume Keyword Strategy
heuristics.condition: If keywords show low search volume, authors incorrectly dismiss them
source_quotes: low number of searches on certain keywords... you shouldn't even bother trying to use those keywords

heuristics.name: Review Count Threshold
heuristics.condition: If median reviews are below 200, prioritize keywords with higher search volume
source_quotes: so many authors they have this idea that if one of these tools tells you this is a not a profitable keyword... they just give up on it

claims.statement: Publisher Rocket is a key tool for Amazon Ads optimization
source_quotes: Publisher Rocket is a key tool that I use

claims.statement: Low search volume keywords can still drive sales through targeted advertising and organic discovery
Publisher Rocket is the second most important tool for Amazon Ads optimization
source_quotes: it is my second most important tool only to Katie spy

niche_patterns.description: Target specific niches with constrained demographics for higher conversion
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Narrower audiences show better engagement metrics
source_quotes: we need to get people there if you think that if you publish it they will come they are definitely not coming
